summary: Small mod aimed at adding some of Link\'s gear to Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
============================================================================
============================================================================
================= GILKS\' LEGEND OF ZELDA: LINKS GEAR MOD ===================
============================================================================
============================================================================

Author: Gilks
Version: 1.0b

======================================

DESCRIPTION: This mod makes some changes (using only Skyrim\'s own models, textures etc. for the moment*) to bring some of the clothing and items 

from the Legend of Zelda series into Skyrim. Here\'s a few details about what I\'ve done...

NEW ITEM: Link\'s Tunic (Standalone Item)
- I\'ve taken the Farm Clothing that looks very much like Link\'s Tunic and made a craftable, temperable/upgradeable standalone version called 

Link\'s Tunic. I\'ve made it a light armor with the same base armor rating as Daedric Armor. I\'ve balanced the armor\'s rating by requiring some 

higher level requirements in order to smith it, making it only obtainable further along in the game. 

IN-GAME DESCRIPTION: An ancient tunic that was said to be worn by a glorious Hero.
BASE ARMOR RATING: 49 (Same as Daedric Armor)
WEIGHT: 1
VALUE: 5600
SMITHING REQUIREMENTS: Iron Ingot, Leather (2), Leather Strips (3)
PERK REQUIREMENTS: Elven Smithing, Arcane Blacksmith
TEMPER/UPGRADE REQUIREMENTS: Iron Ingot (3)

======================================

BUGS: None that I could find, please contact me if you find any.

======================================

FUTURE VERSIONS: 
- Better Balance (Please leave feedback)
- Several Colors to reflect other Tunic\'s from the Zelda Series
- Matching Enchantments that reflect respective abilities from the Zelda Series Tunics
- Retexture of Gauntlets and Boots to match Twilight Princess Gauntlets and Boots
- Quiver Retexture(s)
- User Requests (I\'d love to hear them)
- New Models and Textures (With help from other modders, as I am incapable of doing so myself)

*See \"Future Versions\"
author: Gilks
